Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (2) Resident medications shall be kept in the original pharmacy
Description supplied container until dispensed, shall be kept with the
equipment to administer it in a locked area, and refrigerated, if
required.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During an unannounced visit at the facility the medication cart was
unlocked.
Investigation I completed a walkthrough of Leppien House on December 9,
2024. Upon entering the medication office, the medication cart
was observed to be unlocked. Youth A was laying down in his
bedroom with Staff 1 outside Youth A’s bedroom door. Youth A
was the only youth in the house at the time.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 9, 2024. Staff 1 reported he received the
house/medication keys from Staff 2 at Holbrook at approximately
9am, December 9, 2024. Staff 1 described the keys are supposed
to be passed at the house (Leppien) so the staff receiving the
keys can count the medication, make sure the count is correct,
sign the binder and ensure the medication cart is locked. Staff 1
reported he took Youth A to Leppien to lay down at approximately
9:15-9:30am. Staff 1 reported he could not recall if he went into
the office where the medication cart is located or not when he took
Youth A to the house. Staff 1 stated the medication cart should
have been locked.
Video Review
Video footage of 12/09/24 in the staff office where the medication
cart is located was reviewed on 12/13/2024. Staff 1 is seen
entering the staff office at approximately 8:41am, unlock the
medication cart, place a key in the cart, walk away from the cart
and out of the staff office. Staff 1 does not lock the medication cart
after unlocking and opening the cart. No other person enters the
staff office until the unannounced visit is completed by consultant.
Documents Reviewed:
• Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures,
Residential Storage of Medication: Policy states, “All
medication shall be stored in the locked medication cart.
This locked cart will be placed in a location within each
residence that is an area restricted to residents and that
requires entrance through one locked door.”
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as the medication cart was
left unlocked.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to store the key Staff 1 was
securing in the medication cart in a different locked area to
2

minimize the reason/number of times staff would be unlocking and
getting into the medication cart.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
